element.name: Rostral Mid-Dorsolateral Prefrontal Cortex
element.function: Cognitive control and monitoring to resolve conflict in information processing and competing response plans

element.name: Lateral Mid-Dorsolateral Prefrontal Cortex
element.function: Cognitive control related to stimulus processing and selection of relevant information for behavior

element.name: Inferior Prefrontal Gyrus
element.function: Processing of syntax in oral and sign languages
element.notes: Personality, endurance

element.name: Broca's Area Pars Opercularis
element.notes: Orbital Inferior Frontal Gyrus

element.name: Broca's Area Pars Triangularis
element.function: Language production and prefrontal associational integration, propositional language comprehension
element.notes: Triangular Inferior Frontal Gyrus, switching between semantic sub-categories in word retrieval

element.name: Lateral Frontopolar Cortex
element.notes: Frontopolar area, contains ILC - infralimbic cortex

element.name: Sulcal Rostral Orbitofrontal Cortex
element.function: Gustatory and auditory selection of novelty

element.name: Dorsomedial Prefrontal Cortex
element.function: Ongoing Extroverted Attention to Select Appropriate Response
element.notes: upper MPFC, primary connections to the cingulate and the motor and premotor cortices

element.name: Ventromedial Prefrontal Cortex
element.function: Ongoing Introverted Attention with Regard to Emotions and Feelings, Reward or Punishment
element.notes: lower MPFC, primary connections to limbic and sensory cortices; Reward mediated behaviours

element.name: Anterior Cingulate Area
element.notes: consists of anterior cingulate cortex and middle cingulate cortex

element.name: Anterior Cingulate Cortex
element.notes: Part of limbic lobe

element.name: Ventral Anterior Cingulate Area
element.notes: motor, attentional and cognitive functions; BA24-rostral

element.name: Dorsal Anterior Cingulate Area
element.notes: Anticipate and detect targets, indicate novelty, influence motor responses, encode reward values, and signal errors, motor, attentional and cognitive functions; BA32-rostral

element.name: Subgenual Cingulate Cortex
element.function: Influences changes in appetite and sleep
element.notes: Subdivision of cytoarchitecturally defined cingulate region, emotions, mood and autonomic functions; SOL, VGM

element.name: Medial Cingulate Cortex
element.notes: Part of limbic lobe

element.name: Dorsal Anterior Cingulate Area
element.notes: Anticipate and detect targets, indicate novelty, influence motor responses, encode reward values, and signal errors, motor, attentional and cognitive functions; BA32-caudal

element.name: Pregenual Cingulate Cortex
element.notes: Storage of emotional memory, emotions, mood and autonomic functions

element.name: Motor Cortex
element.notes: F1; Encode individual movements

element.name: Premotor Cortex
element.function: Selection of appropriate motor plans for voluntary movements

element.name: Frontal Eye Field
element.notes: Voluntary saccades and pursuit eye movements

element.name: Caudal Frontal Eye Field
element.function: Head and eye movements toward visual stimuli
element.notes: shorter saccades

element.name: Anterior Frontal Eye Field
element.function: Head and eye movements toward auditory stimuli
element.notes: longer saccades, dorsomedial - 8A (8Ac, 8Am), but not 8Ar; 8Ac - saccades

element.name: Dorsal Caudal Premotor Cortex
element.notes: 6DC; Active during preparation for reach and also during reach itself; leg and arm; transform sensory information into motor representation; preparation and execution of motor acts

element.name: Dorsal Rostral Premotor Cortex
element.function: Associate arbitrary sensory stimuli with specific eye movements
element.notes: 6DR; Can evoke eye movements; strong afferents from DLPFC; convey inputs to caudal concerning motivation, long term plans, memory of past actions; integrates sensory and internally driven inputs for planning of goal-directed actions

element.name: Ventral Caudal Premotor Cortex
element.notes: 6VC; Neurons are especially sensitive to objects in space immediately surrounding body; move head, face and arm

element.name: Ventral Rostral Premotor Cortex
element.notes: 6VR; Mirror neurons - both sensory and motor; arm; F5c=convexity - F1/F4/F2VR/F6/F3/24d/24c, F5p=posterior - F3/F4/F1/24c/24a, F5a=anterior - F4/F6/24c/24d/24a/46v/12r/12l

element.name: Supplementary Motor Cortex
element.function: Process sequences of movements and coordinate bilateral movements

element.name: Supplementary Eye Field
element.function: high level aspects of saccade control
element.notes: Complex spatial transformations, learned transformations, and executive cognitive functions; dorsorostral of F7

element.name: Pre-Supplementary Motor Area
element.function: High level motor functions; Numerical and verbal mental-operation tasks
element.notes: from TH/VLpc, MD from caudate, CR; F5/24c/46; no connections with F1

element.name: Supplementary Motor Area
element.function: Movement execution; Numerical and verbal mental-operation tasks
element.notes: from TH/VLo from from putamen; F1/F2/F4/24d - strong; F6/F7/F5/24c - modest; no input from the prefrontal lobe

element.name: Parietal Lobe
Inferior Parietal Lobule
element.notes: in humans=BA39,40, in monkey=BA7

element.name: Angular Gyrus
element.notes: Surrounds Superior Temporal Sulcus (STS)

element.name: Medial Superior Temporal Area
element.notes: PG, Ventro-dorsal stream

element.name: Supramarginal Wernike Cortex
element.function: Phonological and articulatory processing of words
element.notes: PF, Computing sound of word, tactile learning and memory

element.name: Posterior Cingulate Cortex
element.function: Self-awareness, pain and episodic memory retrieval

element.name: Parietal Operculum
element.notes: Postcentral gyrus

element.name: Secondary Somatosensory Cortex
element.function: Sensorimotor integration, integration of information from two body halves
element.notes: BA 1/3b; projects to PV/7b/INS/AM/HC

element.name: Parietal Ventral Cortex
element.function: Ñreating somatosensory memory, attention, learning and memory

element.element: function="Perception of emotions in facial stimuli and interpretation of sensory information" comments="in human=BA7, PPC - Posterior Parietal Cortex" notes="SMG, Represent spoken words, tool use" >

element.name: Intraparietal Sulcus
element.function: Perceptual-motor coordination and visual attention, eye movements and reaching
element.notes: PG, Control of saccadic eye movements, visual control of grasping

element.name: Medial Intraparietal Sulcus
element.function: Encode location of reach target in nose-centered coordinates

element.name: Lateral Intraparietal Sulcus
element.function: Representing saliency of spatial locations, and attention to locations
element.notes: Targeting eye movements

element.name: Ventral Intraparietal Sulcus
element.function: Merge visual, somatosensory, auditory, and vestibular senses
element.notes: Represent space in head-centered reference frame

element.name: Anterior Intraparietal Sulcus
element.function: Represent shape, size, and orientation of objects to be grasped
element.notes: Both to viewed and remembered stimuli, grasping and manipulating objects through motor and visual inputs

element.name: Primary Visual Cortex
element.notes: Striate Cortex, phyletic memory, not affected by attention

element.name: Secondary Visual Cortex
element.notes: Prestriate Cortex

element.name: Secondary Visual Cortex, Thick Stripe
element.function: Extract binocular disparities and stimulus orientation features

element.name: Associative Visual Cortex
element.function: Processing of global motion, dynamic shapes, orientation
element.notes: Dorsal Extrastriate Cortex

element.name: Fusiform Gyrus
element.notes: Ventral stream, affected by attention

element.name: Dorsal Visual Area V4
element.notes: to TE

element.name: Ventral Visual Area V4
element.notes: to TEO

element.name: Middle Temporal Area
element.function: Integration of local motion signals into global percepts
element.notes: V5, Ventro-dorsal stream, inferior occipital gyrus

element.name: Parietooccipital Area
element.function: Analyzing self-motion relative to the environment, depth
element.notes: V6, DM, Dorsomedial Area, Dorsal stream

element.name: Inferotemporal Cortex
element.notes: Face recognition, high level visual processing

element.name: Preoccipital Inferotemporal Area
element.notes: Part of IT Cortex

element.name: Wernicke's area A3
element.notes: 22a, Melody perception, sequences of tones

element.name: Wernicke's area A4
element.function: Coordinate the activation or deactivation of grammar areas
element.notes: 22b, Grammatical areas, phonemic sequences, word comprehension

element.name: Parainsular Area
element.comment: between insula and 41, supplementary auditory cortex, monkey only; superior bank of superior temporal gyrus, posterior margin of insula
element.notes: Major projects to PFC multi-modal associations, auditory to insula

element.name: Insular Cortex
element.notes: Interoception, merges tactile and auditory streams

element.name: Anterior Insular Cortex
element.function: Risky and moral decision making, articulation

element.name: Anterior Temporal Lobe
element.function: Relaying blood pressure and blood chemistry information to brain
element.notes: Cortical target of information coming through Hering's nerves, active during panic attacks

element.name: Peripaleocortical Claustral
element.notes: Dentate gyrus -> lateropolaris magnoceflularis -> this, agranular orbital, lateral

element.name: Parahippocampal Lobe
element.notes: Parahippocampal gyrus

element.name: Entorhinal Cortex
element.notes: 28 - Posterior Entorhinal Cortex; 34 - Anterior Entorhinal Cortex

element.name: Lateral Entorhinal Cortex
element.notes: non-spatial input to HC; process information about individual items and locations based on a local frame of reference, primarily using external sensory input; it provides the hippocampus with information about content of experience

element.name: Medial Entorhinal Cortex
element.function: Memory consolidation, basic, view inpedepdent position
element.notes: spatial input to HC; grid cells; path integration computations based on a global frame of reference, primarily using internally generated, self-motion cues and external input about environmental boundaries and scenes; provides hippocampus with coordinate system that underlies spatial context of experience

element.name: Perirhinal Cortex
element.function: Associate different visual views of objects and their various nonvisual attributes

element.name: Piriform Cortex
element.function: Perception of smells, primary olfactory cortex
element.notes: Olfaction; dorsal entorhinal area

element.name: Prepyriform Cortex
element.function: Perception of smells, relay via MD to PFC

element.name: Presubiculum
element.notes: Major projects to ET, from TH.LD

element.name: Postsubiculum
element.notes: Detached dorsal part of presubiculum; Integrate visual landmarks with internal representations of environments
element.comments: Retrosubicular Area, similar to BA-36, from perirhinal to presubiculum

element.name: Parasubiculum
element.function: Spatial navigation and the integration of head-directional information
element.notes: Major projects to ET, from CA1,AM
